description.narrative: National Circumstances updated national development priorities in the context of climate change
National Circumstances updated national development priorities in the context of climate change

comment.narrative:
The project counts with information on
a political and geographic aspects b environmental offer c social characteristics d economic characteristics e planning and policy actions related to climate change as of year 2010

The goal for this component is to update information for the period 20082014 on institutional ecosystem social economic and political issues The analysis will be made for the national and regional contexts There will be a close look at the marine and coastal areas and the national circumstances related to extreme weather events will be described A national and regional analysis on the national priorities for the countrys National Development Plan will be presented

With regard to national circumstances progress has been with the issuance of the document on national circumstances that have given way to institutional and territorial vulnerability to the effects of climate change and greenhouse gases emissions in the country

description.narrative: National GHG inventory for the years 2005 2008 and 2010
National GHG inventory for the years 2005 2008 and 2010

comment.narrative: The project counts with information on GHG inventories for 1990 1994 2000 and 2004 The component includes five modules as determined by the 1996 IPCC guidelines 1 Energy 2 Industrial Processes 3 Agriculture 4 Land use land use change and forestry and 5 waste

The goal is to calculate the GHG inventories for the years 2005 2008 and 2010 according to the 2006 IPCC guidelines A database will also be developed with information for each module and emission factors used

Substantial progress has been made in this regard as documentation has been generated and is currently available including technical documents worksheets and reporting tables for the 19902012 series of the National Greenhouse Gases Inventory The National GHG Inventory estimated emissions by sources and removals by sinks of greenhouse gases based on the methodologies expounded in the 2006 IPCC Guidelines for the main sectors Energy Waste Industrial Processes and Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use The inventory results in all sectors have been validated through workshops and interagency working groups In addition quality assurance reviews have been held with international experts for some of the sectors Data are currently being consolidated and integrated for the whole series calculated

description.narrative: National and sectorial mitigation measures compiled and evaluated in the context of the Colombian Low Carbon Development Strategy
Report of information about the actions to mitigate climate change in Colombia

comment.narrative: The project counts with information on national plans and policies related to climate change and Colombias participation in Clean Development Mechanisms

The goal is to report the mitigation actions taken by the country in regard to the implementation of the Colombian Low Carbon Development Strategy CLCDS In addition there will be a description of Colombias participation in international carbon markets and the development of National Appropriate Mitigation Actions NAMAs Finally the progress of the REDD Strategy will be reported

Progress on the issue of mitigation measures is included in the document of mitigation actions carried out by Colombia The latter document reports the developments attained by these actions in the country thereby delving into issues such as the Colombian Low Carbon Development Strategy which covers the Sectorial Action Plans and Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions the Strategy for Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation Colombias participation in carbon markets and addresses the issue of voluntary commitment on mitigation actions under the Cancun agreements

description.narrative: Other information and knowledge relevant for compliance with the UNFCCC objectives
Other information and knowledge relevant for compliance with the UNFCCC objectives

comment.narrative: During the SNC a strategy on education training and public awareness on climate change was initiated The project counts with information on the results of this strategy Also the project counts with additional information related to technology and financial needs for the achievement of the UNFCCC objectives

The goal is to include additional information related to actions that the country has taken on climate change The results obtained in the strategy on education training and public awareness on climate change will be included at the national regional and sectorial levels A summary of the countrys technology needs for adaptation and mitigation which includes the progress on the Technology Needs Assessment TNA

With regard to other relevant information and knowledge for the fulfillment of the objectives of the UNFCCC in Colombia progress has been made in the analysis of financing issues through the progress document which includes information about Colombias sources obstacles and needs in relation to funding for climate change actions which includes global experiences on issues of financing for climate change international methodological routes for the analysis of funding sources and issues related to identification of international national and regional funding sources investment and resources available for climate change funding in the country
Progress has also been made in the field of education through the result analysis report in the implementation of the National Strategy for Education Training and Public Awareness on climate change which involves some of the work currently under way in conjunction with regional nodes of climate change through workshops and surveys

description.narrative: Sectorial and regional vulnerability to climate change in Colombia evaluated according to improved methodologies
Vulnerability to climate change in Colombia evaluated according to improved methodologies

comment.narrative: The country counts with a methodology developed by the SNC for climate change vulnerability analysis There are climate change scenarios available as a tool for vulnerability analyses The project counts with the compilation of results of the various vulnerability and adaptation projects

The TCN seeks to generate updated climate change scenarios for the period 20112100 Identify current and projected threats under climate change Analyze the vulnerability to climate change with a better resolution for the natural regions of Colombia and for water resources glaciers and the health sector Additionally identify the vulnerability to climate variability and extreme events

As for the issue of regional and sectorial vulnerability to climate change significant progress has been made including the preparation and publication of new climate change scenarios for Colombia 20112100 These scenarios were generated both regionally and by departments taking into account variables of precipitation and average temperature and following the methodologies proposed by the IPCC The new scenarios of climate change have been widely disseminated through printed media digital apps posts on IDEAM and UNDP websites and holding events including transmission via streaming meetings and press releases
In addition an analysis was conducted on the annual series for the 19812100 period of the multiscenario assembly for precipitation and temperature variables in order to represent them spatially
